faqs.author: Honeywell Tier-1

faqs.question: How to create and manage custom asset groups for filtering
faqs.answer:
**Asset Group Management:**

**What are Asset Groups:**
- Logical collections of assets
- Used for filtering and rules
- Enable targeted views

**Creating New Group:**

1. **Navigate to Asset Groups**
   - Admin > Asset Management
   - Select Asset Groups tab

2. **Define Criteria**
   - **Manual:** Select specific assets
   - **Dynamic:** Rules-based membership
     * By asset type
     * By department
     * By location
     * By tag model

3. **Configure Group Settings**
   - Group name (unique)
   - Description
   - Icon/color assignment
   - Default map display

**Example Groups:**

| Group Name | Criteria | Use Case |
|------------|----------|----------|
| **Critical Equipment** | Tag battery < 20% | Focus on low-battery items |
| **Mobile Units** | Location = Mobile | Track moveable assets |
| **High-Value** | Asset value > $5000 | Security monitoring |
| **Cleaning Equipment** | Type = Cleaning | Workflow optimization |

**Managing Membership:**

1. **Static Groups:**
   - Add/remove assets manually
   - Good for small, stable groups

2. **Dynamic Groups:**
   - Membership auto-updates
   - Change as assets change
   - No manual maintenance

**Using Groups:**
- Filter map view
- Create rules
- Generate reports
- Set notifications

**Best Practices:**
- Use naming convention
- Document group purposes
- Review quarterly
- Remove unused groups
faqs.author: Honeywell Tier-1

faqs.question: Map loading fails - troubleshooting blank or error screens
faqs.answer:
**Map Loading Issues:**

**Common Error Messages:**
- "Failed to load map"
- "Map data unavailable"
- "Connection timeout"
- Blank gray screen

**Step-by-Step Troubleshooting:**

**1. Verify Network:**
   - Test internet connectivity
   - Check VPN if required
   - Ping map server

**2. Check Browser:**
   - Try incognito/private mode
   - Disable extensions
   - Clear cache and cookies
   - Try different browser

**3. Verify Facility Access:**
   - Confirm user has facility permission
   - Check group membership
   - Verify facility is active

**4. Server Status:**
   - Check map service status
   - Verify database connectivity
   - Look for backend outages

**5. Map File Issues:**
   - Verify map file exists
   - Check file format supported
   - Confirm upload completed

**6. Browser Console:**
   - Open DevTools (F12)
   - Check Console for errors
   - Note any failed requests

**Quick Fixes:**
- Hard refresh (Ctrl+F5)
- Try different facility
- Restart browser

**Escalate if:** Multiple users affected or persists after trying all steps.
faqs.author: Honeywell Tier-1

faqs.question: How to configure and use kiosk mode for public displays
faqs.answer:
**Kiosk Mode Configuration:**

**What is Kiosk Mode:**
- Restricted display mode
- Auto-refreshes map view
- No user interaction required
- Great for public screens

**Setup Steps:**

1. **Create Kiosk User**
   - Admin > Users > Add User
   - Role: Kiosk Viewer (limited)
   - Set auto-login

2. **Configure Display Settings**
   - Select facility/floor to display
   - Set auto-refresh interval (1-5 min)
   - Configure visible asset groups
   - Set default view angle

3. **Enable Kiosk Mode**
   - Settings > Display > Kiosk Mode
   - Toggle enabled
   - Configure idle timeout

4. **Hardware Setup:**
   - Use dedicated display PC
   - Disable screen saver
   - Set power to never sleep
   - Auto-login kiosk user
   - Launch browser in full screen (F11)

**Display Options:**

| Setting | Options | Recommendation |
|---------|---------|---------------|
| **Refresh Rate** | 1-60 minutes | 5 minutes |
| **Zoom Level** | Fit to screen / Fixed | Fit to screen |
| **Assets Shown** | All / Selected | Selected groups |
| **Auto-Refresh** | Yes/No | Yes |

**Maintenance:**
- Monitor uptime weekly
- Check display hardware
- Review coverage quarterly
- Update as facility changes

faqs.question: How to integrate map data with Cisco DNA Spaces

- Cisco DNA Spaces account

faqs.author: Honeywell Tier-1

faqs.question: How to set up and use real-time alerts for asset movement
faqs.answer:
**Real-Time Alert Configuration:**

**Alert Types for Asset Movement:**

1. **Area Entry/Exit**
   - Asset enters defined zone
   - Asset leaves defined zone

2. **Movement Detection**
   - Asset starts moving
   - Asset stops moving

3. **Proximity Alerts**
   - Asset approaches another asset
   - Asset near restricted area

**Configuration Steps:**

1. **Define Alert Conditions**
   - Navigate to Admin > Alerts
   - Create new alert rule
   - Select condition type

2. **Select Trigger Criteria**
   - Choose asset group(s)
   - Define area(s) or zones
   - Set time conditions

3. **Configure Notifications**
   - Select recipients
   - Choose delivery method:
     * In-app notification
     * Email alert

4. **Test Alert**

**Example Alert Rules:**

   - Remove confidential information

3. **Optimize File Size**

   - Remove unused layers

1. **Navigate to Floor Plans**

2. **Upload File**

   - Select file

3. **Configure Settings**
   - Set floor height
   - Define building footprint
   - Set measurement units

4. **Align Map**

   - Set reference points
   - Test accuracy

**Best Practices:**
- Keep original CAD files
- Update when renovations occur
- Document any modifications
- Use consistent naming convention

**Common Issues:**

- File too large → Reduce resolution

faqs.question: How to troubleshoot real-time location delays and latency
faqs.answer:
**Real-Time Latency Troubleshooting:**

**Expected Performance:**
- Normal: Location updates every 5-30 seconds
- Near real-time: 1-5 seconds with good coverage
- Delayed: Updates > 30 seconds

**Diagnostic Steps:**

1. **Check Tag Status**
   - Verify tag online
   - Check last communication time
   - Review battery level

2. **Network Assessment**
   - Test network latency to server
   - Check for packet loss
   - Verify Wi-Fi signal strength

3. **Coverage Analysis**
   - Number of visible APs
   - Signal strength per AP
   - Identify weak coverage areas

4. **Server Status**
   - Check processing load
   - Verify database performance
   - Monitor for bottlenecks

**Common Causes & Solutions:**

| Symptom | Likely Cause | Solution |
|---------|--------------|----------|
| All tags delayed | Server overload | Scale infrastructure |
| Single tag delayed | Tag issue | Replace tag |
| Area delayed | Coverage gap | Add APs/gateways |
| Intermittent | Network issue | Fix connectivity |

**Optimization Tips:**

1. **Improve Coverage**
   - Add access points
   - Use BLE gateways
   - Remove obstacles

2. **Network Optimization**
   - Reduce latency paths
   - Prioritize RTLS traffic
   - Upgrade network equipment

3. **Tag Configuration**
   - Increase update frequency
   - Ensure optimal settings
   - Replace aging tags

**Monitoring:**
- Set up latency alerts
- Track average update time
- Monitor during peak hours

faqs.question: Mobile app map view - differences and limitations compared to web
faqs.answer:
**Mobile Map Differences:**

**Feature Comparison:**

| Feature | Web | Mobile | Notes |
|---------|-----|--------|-------|
| **2D Map** | Full | Limited | Simplified view |
| **3D Map** | Full | None | Not supported |
| **Multi-Floor** | Full | Stacked | Limited stack |
| **Overlays** | Full | Basic | Select few |
| **Filters** | Full | Simplified | Quick filters |
| **Search** | Full | Basic | Location search |
| **Asset Detail** | Full | Summary | Limited info |
| **Reports** | Full | None | Use web |

**Mobile Advantages:**
- Quick location check
- On-the-go status
- Push notifications
- Near real-time updates

**Mobile Limitations:**
- No complex filtering
- Cannot configure rules
- Limited editing capabilities
- No report generation
- Reduced visual detail

**Optimization for Mobile:**
- Use pre-configured views
- Set favorite facilities
- Enable notifications
- Use quick filters

**Best Use Cases:**
- Quick location verification
- Alert acknowledgment
- Asset status check
- Finding nearest asset

**Not Recommended:**
- Complex troubleshooting
- Report generation
- Configuration changes
- Detailed analytics

**Tips:**
- Save frequently used views
- Enable offline mode if available
- Use Wi-Fi for better performance
